ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to speak Korean much better! Also learned many new vocab words too.

I learned how to write in the statement style and am much better at written Korean now than I was beforehand. I also gained a lot of practice in logically explaining my thoughts in Korean rather than just a simple statement. We also did a lot of societal/cultural segments that taught me a lot about the Korean workplace and issues such as gender discrimination, racism, etc. in Korea.

I was able to improve my communication skills in the Korean language through having conversations with fellow classmates every week and receiving helpful feedback from my instructor. I especially enjoyed having debates in Korean which helped improve fluency but also gain valuable insight on topics related to Korean culture.
I definitely believe my Korean speaking and writing ability greatly improved.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Very fun, relaxing environment to learn Korean! Strengths were having the course based upon a korean drama, but the weaknesses are that sometimes just talking about Misaeng can get a little repetitive and redundant.

The strength is definitely the instructor. Professor Back was so enthusiastic about this class and it showed! It was also very nice to have a mix of heritage and a few non-heritage speakers so we could have a variety of perspectives during debates. Having a smaller class that encourages interaction was extremely helpful in becoming comfortable in making mistakes in front of my classmates, and it built a lot of camaraderie among our class. Another strength was the weekly TA sections, in which I was able to speak in Korean for about an hour with a TA. It's really important to not just learn things in class, but also have to produce Korean in organic situations, which the TA sections were perfect for. Weaknesses: Some of the course material felt dated and not very relevant today, especially the Misaeng worksheets we had to fill out. The drama that we watched throughout the semester, Misaeng, was also extremely difficult to follow because of the complex business plot (even reading English subtitles was difficult).

I enjoyed having debates as a class and receiving feedback from my instructor; however, I wish we could have gone over new vocabulary in class before having to write sentences for our assignments. Although I was able to have many of my questions addressed through meeting with the teaching fellow, it would have been more convenient to have already discussed them in class.
more focus on using vocabulary would be nice

I love the small seminar environment of this course as well as the professor in trying to engage her students. I wish there were more opportunities to have fun while engaging with the Korean culture through activities.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes!! I wasn't taking this class for my language requirement, I was mostly just taking the class for fun. But if you're looking to take it for lang requirement or even for fun, I highly recommend!

Yes, especially with Professor Back! It was very nice to be in a heritage class and you get very comfortable and close with your classmates throughout the semester. It's also just a very fun class, and I looked forward to attending each time.

I would recommend this course to another student. The workload was not heavy at all, and the instructor provided very useful feedback. I enjoyed doing the assignments and attending class every week. The teaching style of my instructor was unlike any I have seen in other language classes; it was interesting, and I truly enjoyed being in my instructor's class.
I definitely would recommend this course to another student who wants to get better at Korean, with writing especially.

extras.title: KREN 152 02 - Adv Korean for Adv Learners
